I'd be happy to help you understand why the "Computational Fluid Dynamics" course is recommended for someone aspiring to be a DevOps Engineer. While it may not seem directly related, the skills and knowledge gained from this course can be surprisingly beneficial for a career in DevOps.

Theoretical knowledge of Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) provides a solid understanding of problem-solving skills, which are highly transferable to DevOps engineering. In CFD, students learn to break down complex problems into manageable components, analyze data, and identify potential issues - all essential skills for troubleshooting and resolving complex system problems in DevOps.

Moreover, the practical experience gained from writing and testing CFD codes can be applied to debugging and optimizing code in various programming languages. Additionally, understanding numerical methods and linear systems of equations, which are fundamental concepts in CFD, can help develop a deeper appreciation for algorithms and data structures commonly used in software development.

Overall, while DevOps engineering may not require direct application of CFD principles, the skills and mindset developed through this course can significantly enhance one's ability to approach complex problems, analyze data, and optimize system performance - all valuable assets for a career in DevOps.
